intro: Calceolaria harlingii, commonly known as the Harling's slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean highlands of South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is known for its delicate, hairy leaves and compact growth habit. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its striking appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
